meanings.definition: Fastened or secured with a buckle.
meanings.sent1: The buckled shoes were shiny and new.
meanings.sent2: She wore a buckled belt with her dress.
meanings.sent3: The buckled hat made him look like a stylish cowboy.
meanings.sent4: The buckled suitcase held all her belongings safely.
meanings.sent5: The buckled collar kept the dog secure during the walk.

meanings.definition: Collapsed or gave way under pressure.
meanings.sent1: The old bridge buckled under the weight of the truck.
meanings.sent2: His knees buckled from exhaustion after the long hike.
meanings.sent3: The table buckled under the weight of too many books.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve finally buckled under the constant stress.
meanings.sent5: The dam buckled under the force of the floodwaters.

meanings.definition: Bent or twisted out of shape.
meanings.sent1: The buckled frame of the car was a result of the accident.
meanings.sent2: The buckled paper had creases all over.
meanings.sent3: The buckled tree branch looked like a twisted snake.
meanings.sent4: The buckled metal fence needed to be straightened.
meanings.sent5: The buckled wire was difficult to untangle.
